question: [File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/mempool/mod.rs] [Function: mempool_handle_parking_lot_address_request()] [Complete Service Bypass] Since authentication is checked in parent mod.rs before routing to this handler, if there's a vulnerability in the routing logic, can unauthenticated requests reach mempool_handle_parking_lot_address_request? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/mempool/mod.rs] [Function: get_parking_lot_addresses()] [Mempool Coordinator Crash] If the mempool coordinator task crashes while processing GetAddressesFromParkingLot request, does the admin service detect this and fail gracefully, or can it cause cascading failures across validator services? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-admin-service/src/server/mempool/mod.rs] [Function: mempool_handle_parking_lot_address_request()] [Node Shutdown Race] During validator node shutdown, if mempool_client_sender is closed but admin service is still accepting requests, can this cause panics or undefined behavior when get_parking_lot_addresses executes at line 16?
